summary: The federal government invests more than $100 billion annually in IT. But these investments can be poorly managed—resulting in IT that fails to deliver needed improvements and is often late and over budget. A law aimed at improving IT management requires agencies to review their portfolios of IT projects and high-risk IT investments. Our ongoing analysis shows that agencies haven't completed these reviews. This statement...
title: IT Portfolio Management: Preliminary Results of Federal Efforts to Address Statutory Requirements
